questions: Be independent and do things your own way. Your manager tells you to redo a report using a new template, but the old format was clearer and the client preferred it. What do you do?
Be independent and do things your own way. IT says everyone must use the company VPN even when working from the office, and it makes your internet painfully slow. How do you handle it?
Be independent and do things your own way. Your professor requires a 20-page minimum for the final paper, but you've made your argument convincingly in 12. What do you do?
Be independent and do things your own way. Company policy says all code changes require a two-person review, even one-character typo fixes that are blocking deployment. How do you proceed?
Be independent and do things your own way. HR mandates that all teams attend a four-hour team-building exercise on Friday afternoon when you have a deadline Monday. What do you do?

Be independent and do things your own way. Your doctor recommends a daily medication for mildly elevated cholesterol even though you feel healthy, exercise regularly, and eat well. How do you respond?

Be independent and do things your own way. The HOA sends a notice that all holiday decorations must be removed by January 2nd or face a $50 fine. It's December 30th and you usually leave lights up through mid-January. What do you do?

Be independent and do things your own way. Your team lead says everyone must be in the office by 8am sharp, even though your role has no morning meetings and you do your best work late. How do you handle it?
Be independent and do things your own way. The school requires parents to volunteer 20 hours per semester or pay a $200 fee, even though you already donate money. What do you do?
Be independent and do things your own way. A senior engineer insists your PR needs to follow a design pattern you think is overcomplicated for this use case. How do you respond?
Be independent and do things your own way. Airport security asks you to remove your shoes, belt, and laptop even though you have TSA PreCheck and the scanner doesn't require it. What do you do?

Be independent and do things your own way. Your gym implements a rule that all members must wipe down equipment after use, even machines you only sat on briefly without sweating. How do you handle it?
Be independent and do things your own way. Your company requires expense reports for any purchase over $25, even for a $26 team lunch. What do you do?

Be independent and do things your own way. A building inspector says your deck railing needs to be 2 inches higher to meet the updated code, even though it passed inspection last year. How do you proceed?
Be independent and do things your own way. Your advisor tells you to drop one of your five courses because they think you're overloaded, but you feel fine. What do you do?
